citations.narrative:
Structural strength. There were 5 adult male guinea pigs loose on the floor of the animal room that escaped from a lower
enclosure. Guinea pigs escaping from their primary enclosures could be injured from falling from racks, exiting the animal
room, or unable to locate adequate food and water resources. Housing facilities must be structurally sound and
maintained in good repair to prevent guinea pigs from escaping their primary enclosures. Primary enclosures must be
repaired to prevent guinea pigs from escaping. Correct by January 25, 2024.

Housekeeping. The floor in the animal room contains accumulations of loose hay and debris. There is dirt and debris on
the shelf in the front corner and cobwebs, dust, and debris on the walls. Animal facilities must be kept clean to ensure
good quality of air for the animals and to prevent unnecessary disease risks. Correct by ensuring the premises are kept
clean, including: removing cobwebs, dust, and debris from walls and shelf; cleaning hay from the floor and under racks;
and maintaining a level of cleanliness to support good husbandry and health. Correct by January 20, 2024.
This inspection was conducted with the licensee and the exit interview was conducted with an employee.
n

narrative:
3.25(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Structural strength. There were 5 adult male guinea pigs loose on the floor of the animal room that escaped from a lower 
enclosure. Guinea pigs escaping from their primary enclosures could be injured from falling from racks, exiting the animal 
room, or unable to locate adequate food and water resources. Housing facilities must be structurally sound and 
maintained in good repair to prevent guinea pigs from escaping their primary enclosures. Primary enclosures must be 
repaired to prevent guinea pigs from escaping. Correct by January 25, 2024. 
3.31(b) 
   
Sanitation. 
Housekeeping. The floor in the animal room contains accumulations of loose hay and debris. There is dirt and debris on 
the shelf in the front corner and cobwebs, dust, and debris on the walls. Animal facilities must be kept clean to ensure 
good quality of air for the animals and to prevent unnecessary disease risks. Correct by ensuring the premises are kept 
clean, including: removing cobwebs, dust, and debris from walls and shelf; cleaning hay from the floor and under racks; 
and maintaining a level of cleanliness to support good husbandry and health. Correct by January 20, 2024. 
 
This inspection was conducted with the licensee and the exit interview was conducted with an employee.
